text: Hi <@U04AQA0QM8E>, thank you! That was indeed the issue.

HI Everyone, I'm new in developing in HubSpot. I was given a project where I need to put a module on webpage and pull a email address from a website url and have it auto populate into a HubSpot form, and then have the form auto submit without the customer pressing submit. Is there a easy way to do this? I'm on a tight deadline and haven't done this before.  Any help would be appreciated. Thank you

you can autocomplete a HubSpot form by just adding the relative field name as a parameter on a web page (so for example you can do <http://www.yourwebsite.com?email=email@address.com|www.yourwebsite.com?email=email@address.com>), for the autosubmit you can take a look at <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/global-form-events|HubSpot form events> and listen for the onFormReady event and submit it via JS
